threat: Unauthorized Manipulation of Consumer Electronics Devices
threat_description: Adversaries may tamper with hardware, firmware, or software components of consumer electronics to degrade performance, disable functionality, or damage brand reputation. This threat exploits gaps in physical security, access control, or validation mechanisms.

components.name: Physical Devices
components.description: Hardware infrastructure enabling product functionality.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-284: Improper Access Control
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper access controls at the hardware level may allow tampering and sabotage.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1255: Comparison with Incorrect Byte Count
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper hardware component isolation can enable sabotage across security boundaries.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1231: Improper Prevention of Lock Bit Modification
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper prevention of lock bit modification allows unauthorized hardware configuration changes.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1244: Internal Asset Exposed to Untrusted Actors
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Internal asset exposed to untrusted actors can lead to physical tampering of device components.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1278: Missing Protection Against Hardware Reverse Engineering Using Integrated Circuit
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Absence of secure boot code signing can enable sabotage via malicious firmware updates.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-912: Hidden Functionality
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Hidden functionality in firmware can be triggered to cause device malfunction.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1277: Firmware Not Using Cryptographic Signature
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Firmware not using cryptographic signatures allows unauthorized modifications.

components.name: User Accounts
components.description: Accounts granting authenticated access to devices or services.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-384: Session Fixation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Session fixation can lead to unauthorized user-level sabotage.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-287: Improper Authentication
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper authentication allows attackers to gain access to user accounts for sabotage.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-640: Weak Password Recovery Mechanism for Forgotten Password
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Weak password recovery mechanism for forgotten password can be exploited for account takeover.

components.name: Device Software
components.description: Firmware/OS and related update processes on consumer devices.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-787: Out-of-bounds Write
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unbounded buffer operations let attackers insert malicious code that can sabotage services.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-494: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Download of code without integrity check allows injection of malicious updates.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-829: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Inclusion of functionality from untrusted control sphere enables sabotage through update channels.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-319: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Weak encryption or insecure channels can let bad actors push sabotage code via fake updates.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-295: Improper Certificate Validation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper certificate validation allows man-in-the-middle attacks to deliver malicious updates.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-347: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper verification of cryptographic signature enables distribution of unauthorized updates.

components.name: Smart Home Devices
components.description: Connected consumer devices with automation or remote control features.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-862: Missing Authorization
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing authorization checks can allow device manipulation and sabotage of firmware controls.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing authentication for critical function enables unauthorized control of smart home systems.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-613: Insufficient Session Expiration
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficient session expiration allows prolonged unauthorized access to device controls.

threat_description: Attackers may target personal or operational data stored or transmitted by consumer devices, leveraging weak encryption, misconfigured access controls, or insecure communication protocols to steal sensitive information.

components.name: User Data
components.description: Storage and management of personally identifiable information.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-532: Insertion of Sensitive Information into Log File
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Sensitive information logged in plaintext can be stolen for privacy exploitation.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-312: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Cleartext storage of sensitive information enables direct theft of personal data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-359: Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposure of private information to unauthorized actors leads to privacy violations.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-284: Improper Access Control
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper cloud access control can let attackers exfiltrate vast amounts of user data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficiently protected credentials can lead to unauthorized cloud storage access.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-668: Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposure of resource to wrong sphere allows unauthorized access to cloud-stored user data.

components.name: Communication Interfaces
components.description: Protocols or hardware used to transmit data (Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, etc.).

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-319: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Lack of encryption can expose personal data during transmission.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-300: Channel Accessible by Non-Endpoint
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Channel accessible by non-endpoint allows eavesdropping on sensitive communications.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposure of sensitive information to unauthorized actor enables data theft during transmission.

components.name: Content Protection Systems
components.description: Technologies preventing unauthorized copying or distribution of content.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-321: Use of Hard-coded Cryptographic Key
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Hard-coded or weak keys can be exploited to bypass DRM and steal protected data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-798: Use of Hard-coded Credentials
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Use of hard-coded credentials allows extraction of encryption keys for content theft.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Use of broken or risky cryptographic algorithm enables decryption of protected content.

components.name: User Profiles
components.description: Personal information stored on devices or cloud services.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-359: Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposure of private information can lead to identity theft and account takeover.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-311: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing encryption of sensitive data enables theft of personal identifiers.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-732: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Incorrect permission assignment for critical resource allows unauthorized access to user profiles.

threat_description: Covert acquisition of proprietary data or technology. Attackers may rely on advanced intrusion techniques or insider threats to gather trade secrets, research details, or other sensitive information for competitive or financial advantage.

components.name: Device Software
components.description: Operating environment for consumer devices (OS, firmware, etc.).

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-20: Improper Input Validation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Faulty validation can let intruders run espionage-focused code to exfiltrate sensitive intellectual property.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-345: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficient verification of data authenticity allows injection of malicious code for espionage.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-754: Improper Check for Unusual or Exceptional Conditions
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper check for unusual or exceptional conditions enables exploitation for corporate espionage.

components.name: Voice Assistant Systems
components.description: Devices processing voice commands for user convenience.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-94: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Code injection through malicious audio input can capture sensitive voice data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-311: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing encryption of sensitive data allows interception of voice recordings.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposure of sensitive information to unauthorized actor enables voice data theft.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-78: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an OS Command ('OS Command Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: OS command injection can allow siphoning of private recordings or transcripts.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-77: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper neutralization of special elements in commands enables espionage through voice systems.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-74: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements in Output Used by a Downstream Component ('Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper neutralization of special elements in output allows extraction of sensitive voice data.

components.name: Internet of Things (IoT) Devices
components.description: Connected devices collecting and exchanging data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-319: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unencrypted transmissions let insiders or external attackers secretly intercept data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-300: Channel Accessible by Non-Endpoint
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Channel accessible by non-endpoint enables eavesdropping on sensitive corporate communications.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-294: Authentication Bypass by Capture-replay
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Authentication bypass by capture-replay allows interception of IoT device communications.

threat_description: Production or distribution of unauthorized replicas that mimic legitimate consumer electronics. These goods can contain substandard materials or malware, eroding brand trust and risking consumer safety.

components.name: Manufacturing Process
components.description: Processes and suppliers used to build device hardware.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-910: Use of Expired or Revoked Certificate
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Weak supply chain checks allow unverified components, leading to counterfeit duplication.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1236: Improper Neutralization of Formula Elements in a CSV File
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper neutralization of formula elements in a CSV file enables injection of counterfeit part numbers.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-345: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficient verification of data authenticity allows counterfeit components to enter supply chain.

components.name: Distribution Channels
components.description: Channels or marketplaces where products reach end users.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Fake listings or redirects can harm brand integrity by pushing counterfeit goods.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-290: Authentication Bypass by Spoofing
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Authentication bypass by spoofing allows counterfeiters to pose as legitimate sellers.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-350: Reliance on Reverse DNS Resolution for a Security-Critical Action
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Reliance on reverse DNS resolution for authentication enables spoofing of legitimate retail sites.

components.name: Product Authentication
components.description: Methods to verify genuine products from counterfeits.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-327: Use of a Broken or Risky Cryptographic Algorithm
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Use of broken or risky cryptographic algorithms enables counterfeiters to duplicate authentication markers.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-330: Use of Insufficiently Random Values
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Use of insufficiently random values allows prediction of authentication codes.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-347: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper verification of cryptographic signature enables forgery of product authentication tags.

threat_description: Intentional interference with production or distribution networks. Attackers aim to create manufacturing delays, degrade product quality, or cause logistical upheavals, leading to significant operational and financial harm.

components.name: Logistics Systems
components.description: Platforms coordinating product transport, inventory, and fulfillment.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-89: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in an SQL Command ('SQL Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: SQL injection can reorder or sabotage shipping schedules, causing market chaos.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-285: Improper Authorization
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper authorization allows manipulation of inventory data to disrupt supply chains.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-352: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Cross-site request forgery enables unauthorized changes to logistics information.

components.name: Transportation Infrastructure
components.description: Shipping routes, trucking services, or warehousing for products.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-284: Improper Access Control
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Attackers can hijack routing data to delay goods until ransom demands are met.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing authentication for critical function allows unauthorized changes to shipping routes.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-862: Missing Authorization
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing authorization allows manipulation of transportation schedules for extortion.

components.name: Component Sourcing
components.description: Processes for acquiring parts and materials for manufacturing.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-345: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficient verification of data authenticity can allow manipulation of supplier information.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-807: Reliance on Untrusted Inputs in a Security Decision
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Reliance on untrusted inputs in a security decision enables infiltration of supply chain.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-829: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Inclusion of functionality from untrusted control sphere allows compromise of sourcing systems.

threat: Misuse or Impersonation of Brand Identity
threat_description: Misuse or impersonation of a legitimate consumer electronics brand, often through phishing sites or unauthorized marketing, leading to reputational harm or data compromises.

components.name: Customer-Facing Channels
components.description: Websites, apps, or social media accounts representing the brand.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Open redirects or cloned domains trick consumers into trusting fake brand portals.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Cross-site scripting allows injection of malicious content into legitimate brand websites.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1021: Improper Restriction of Rendered UI Layers or Frames
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper restriction of rendered UI layers or frames enables convincing brand impersonation.

components.name: Consumer Interaction Points
components.description: Pages or forms collecting user information under brand identity.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improperly protected credentials on phony brand pages can be stolen by attackers.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-620: Unverified Password Change
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unverified password change enables account takeover through fake password reset forms.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-646: Reliance on File Name or Path Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Reliance on file name or path information allows convincing phishing through familiar URLs.

components.name: E-commerce Platforms
components.description: Online stores selling consumer electronics products.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-352: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: CSRF vulnerabilities in fake brand sites can lead to unauthorized financial transactions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-565: Reliance on Cookies without Validation and Integrity Checking
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Reliance on cookies without validation enables session hijacking in e-commerce sites.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-639: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Authorization bypass through user-controlled key allows fraudulent transactions.

threat_description: Insertion or modification of malicious code within device firmware. Attackers may gain persistent control or the ability to degrade, disable, or spy on hardware functionality.

components.name: Firmware Distribution
components.description: Process and channels through which firmware is deployed to devices.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-494: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Lack of integrity checks on firmware updates can allow malicious modifications before deployment.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-426: Untrusted Search Path
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Untrusted search path allows loading of malicious firmware components.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-347: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper verification of cryptographic signature enables distribution of compromised firmware.

components.name: Bootloader
components.description: Low-level software that initializes the firmware and hardware on startup.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1278: Missing Protection Against Hardware Reverse Engineering Using Integrated Circuit
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unprotected bootloading routines allow tampering that grants persistent espionage or sabotage.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1277: Firmware Not Using Cryptographic Signature
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Firmware not using cryptographic signatures allows bootloader compromise.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1326: Missing Immutable Root of Trust in Hardware
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing immutable root of trust in hardware enables persistent firmware compromise.

components.name: Device Drivers
components.description: Software components that interface with hardware components.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-276: Incorrect Default Permissions
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Incorrect default permissions in drivers can allow persistent backdoor installation.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-272: Least Privilege Violation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Least privilege violation in driver code enables escalation to install backdoors.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-912: Hidden Functionality
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Hidden functionality in driver code can serve as a backdoor for persistent access.

threat: Privileged Access Abuse by Internal Actors
threat_description: Malicious or negligent actions by employees, contractors, or partners who have authorized access to consumer electronics data or systems. These insiders can steal IP, sabotage operations, or leak confidential details.

components.name: Internal Access Points
components.description: Privileged portals where insiders can access critical systems or manufacturing processes.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-269: Improper Privilege Management
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper privilege management allows insiders to misuse or steal valuable data or resources.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-250: Execution with Unnecessary Privileges
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Execution with unnecessary privileges enables insiders to access unauthorized resources.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-732: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Incorrect permission assignment for critical resource allows insiders to exploit admin tools.

components.name: Employee Privileges
components.description: Local or remote access rights granted to trusted personnel.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficiently protected credentials allow a disgruntled insider to sabotage systems.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-798: Use of Hard-coded Credentials
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Use of hard-coded credentials enables access even after termination of employment.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-262: Not Using Password Aging
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Not using password aging allows terminated employees to retain access.

components.name: Product Development
components.description: Systems and processes for designing and testing new products.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-668: Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposure of resource to wrong sphere allows ideologically-motivated insiders to leak sensitive designs.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-552: Files or Directories Accessible to External Parties
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Files or directories accessible to external parties enables leaking of proprietary designs.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-359: Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposure of private information to unauthorized actor allows insiders to leak confidential designs.

threat: Unauthorized Access to Confidential Engineering Assets
threat_description: Threat actors may target design files, prototypes, or source code stored in engineering systems or collaboration platforms. The threat is enabled by poor access control, weak encryption, or insecure file sharing practices.

components.name: Engineering Data Repositories
components.description: Secure repositories containing schematics, source code, or production details.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-552: Files or Directories Accessible to External Parties
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Files or directories inappropriately exposed can leak intellectual property.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Weak encryption for design files can facilitate IP theft through unauthorized downloads.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-668: Exposure of Resource to Wrong Sphere
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposure of resource to wrong sphere allows unauthorized access to proprietary designs.

components.name: Collaboration Tools
components.description: Platforms where team members share prototypes, code reviews, or technical data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-284: Improper Access Control
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper access controls on collaboration tools allow spies to extract confidential IP.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-285: Improper Authorization
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper authorization enables unauthorized access to sensitive design documents.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-639: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Authorization bypass through user-controlled key allows access to restricted documents.

components.name: Patent Documentation
components.description: Legal and technical documents describing protected innovations.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-311: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing encryption of sensitive data allows theft of pre-filing patent information.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-359: Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposure of private information to unauthorized actor enables theft of patent details.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-200: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposure of sensitive information to unauthorized actor allows access to confidential patent data.

threat: Abuse of Device Resources for Unauthorized Computation
threat_description: Adversaries may hijack device CPUs, GPUs, or firmware for unauthorized activities like cryptocurrency mining or botnet participation. This threat is driven by privilege escalation, hidden code injection, or software supply chain weaknesses.

components.name: Application Layer
components.description: Device apps or services that can be hijacked for cryptomining processes.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-94: Improper Control of Generation of Code ('Code Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Remote code injection can embed cryptomining scripts into legitimate applications.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-79: Improper Neutralization of Input During Web Page Generation ('Cross-site Scripting')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Cross-site scripting allows injection of cryptomining code into web applications.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-829: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Inclusion of functionality from untrusted control sphere enables loading of mining scripts.

components.name: Device Firmware or OS
components.description: Underlying software environment that attackers can exploit to maintain hidden miners.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-269: Improper Privilege Management
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper privilege management can allow cryptominers to run undetected at OS boot.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-912: Hidden Functionality
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Hidden functionality in startup services enables persistent cryptomining operations.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-470: Use of Externally-Controlled Input to Select Classes or Code ('Unsafe Reflection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Use of externally-controlled input to select classes or code allows loading of mining modules.

components.name: Network-Connected Devices
components.description: Consumer electronics with internet connectivity.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-250: Execution with Unnecessary Privileges
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Execution with unnecessary privileges allows attackers to run resource-intensive tasks undetected.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-705: Incorrect Control Flow Scoping
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Incorrect control flow scoping enables hidden execution of resource-intensive operations.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-770: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Allocation of resources without limits or throttling allows excessive resource consumption.

threat_description: Exhausting or overwhelming device or service resources so they become unavailable to legitimate users. Can impact consumer electronics platforms, customer support portals, or connected devices, causing service outages and eroding user trust.

components.name: Cloud Services
components.description: Hosted infrastructures supporting product functionality or updates.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-400: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Uncontrolled resource consumption can be exploited to cause deliberate overload and outcompete a rival's service.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-770: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Allocation of resources without limits or throttling enables denial of service attacks.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-799: Improper Control of Interaction Frequency
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper control of interaction frequency allows flooding of service requests.

components.name: Device Connectivity
components.description: Network-dependent features of consumer electronics, e.g., IoT or smart devices.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-406: Insufficient Control of Network Message Volume (Network Amplification)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper handling of messages can lead to queue saturation and outages, enabling extortion attempts.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-400: Uncontrolled Resource Consumption
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Uncontrolled resource consumption in message processing enables denial of service.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-770: Allocation of Resources Without Limits or Throttling
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Allocation of resources without limits or throttling allows message queue flooding.

components.name: Public-Facing Portals
components.description: Websites or customer portals representing consumer electronics brands.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-601: URL Redirection to Untrusted Site ('Open Redirect')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Redirect abuse can amplify DOS or defacement, fulfilling activist agendas to disrupt brand presence.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-352: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Cross-site request forgery enables unauthorized actions that can disrupt services.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-799: Improper Control of Interaction Frequency
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper control of interaction frequency allows flooding of web requests.

threat: Unauthorized Access to Consumer Device Interfaces
threat_description: Unauthorized takeover of devices, allowing attackers to control functions, access sensitive data, or redirect usage. Often achieved via exploitable remote management interfaces or vulnerabilities in network protocols.

components.name: Smart Home Hubs
components.description: Central controllers for home automation systems and connected devices.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-287: Improper Authentication
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper authentication can yield full remote control for malicious personal benefit.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing authentication for critical function enables unauthorized device control.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-798: Use of Hard-coded Credentials
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Use of hard-coded credentials allows unauthorized access to admin interfaces.

components.name: Cloud-Connected Cameras
components.description: Cameras with online streaming and monitoring features.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-319: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Unencrypted streaming channels let attackers hijack camera feeds for large-scale privacy violations.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-294: Authentication Bypass by Capture-replay
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Authentication bypass by capture-replay allows unauthorized access to camera feeds.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-300: Channel Accessible by Non-Endpoint
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Channel accessible by non-endpoint enables interception of camera streams.

components.name: User Profiles
components.description: Credential and personalization data tied to connected devices.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficient token protection can facilitate remote takeover and subsequent data exfiltration.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-613: Insufficient Session Expiration
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficient session expiration allows prolonged unauthorized access to user data.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-384: Session Fixation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Session fixation enables attackers to hijack legitimate user sessions.

threat: Distribution of Malicious Software Through Device Ecosystem
threat_description: Spreading malicious software through consumer electronics ecosystems, potentially infecting users' devices or leveraging them to reach broader networks. This software may enable backdoors, data exfiltration, or resource hijacking.

components.name: Connected Appliances
components.description: Everyday devices (TVs, refrigerators, etc.) with internet connectivity.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1278: Missing Protection Against Hardware Reverse Engineering Using Integrated Circuit
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Firmware lacking signature checks allows malware injection, forming large-scale IoT botnets.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-494: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Download of code without integrity check enables malware installation on connected devices.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-912: Hidden Functionality
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Hidden functionality in firmware can serve as a backdoor for botnet recruitment.

components.name: Media Streaming Devices
components.description: Streaming sticks or set-top boxes for online video and audio.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-494: Download of Code Without Integrity Check
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Malware-laced updates can be pushed to extort ransoms for device unlock or data recovery.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-829: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Inclusion of functionality from untrusted control sphere enables ransomware distribution.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-347: Improper Verification of Cryptographic Signature
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper verification of cryptographic signature allows distribution of malicious updates.

components.name: Mobile App Ecosystem
components.description: Apps installed on smartphones or tablets to control or interact with consumer devices.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-829: Inclusion of Functionality from Untrusted Control Sphere
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Inclusion of untrusted code can distribute malware widely, crippling user devices en masse.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1104: Use of Unmaintained Third Party Components
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Use of unmaintained third-party components with known vulnerabilities enables malware distribution.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-506: Embedded Malicious Code
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Embedded malicious code in libraries can be widely distributed through legitimate apps.

threat: Unauthorized Alteration of Consumer Device Data or Configuration
threat_description: Threat actors may modify logs, settings, or operational state in consumer electronics systems to conceal activity, commit fraud, or disrupt behavior. This threat targets the integrity of stored and runtime data.

components.name: Billing Systems
components.description: Components managing in-app or subscription-based payments for devices.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-285: Improper Authorization
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper authorization can let attackers alter payment logs or inflate costs for personal profit.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-642: External Control of Critical State Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: External control of critical state data allows manipulation of transaction amounts.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-843: Access of Resource Using Incompatible Type ('Type Confusion')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Access of resource using incompatible type enables corruption of financial records.

components.name: Firmware Logs
components.description: System logs documenting operational and security events within device firmware.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-117: Improper Output Neutralization for Logs
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper output neutralization lets attackers falsify logs, implicating legitimate parties or hiding breaches.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-93: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences ('CRLF Injection')
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper neutralization of CRLF sequences allows log injection attacks.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-778: Insufficient Logging
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficient logging allows attackers to hide their activities from audit trails.

components.name: Configuration Files
components.description: Files defining device operational modes or security settings.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-125: Out-of-bounds Read
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Out-of-bounds reads/writes can corrupt critical settings, rendering devices unstable or unusable.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-642: External Control of Critical State Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: External control of critical state data allows manipulation of device configuration.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-15: External Control of System or Configuration Setting
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: External control of system or configuration settings enables malicious reconfiguration.

threat_description: This threat involves attackers compromising payment gateways, e-commerce platforms, or user accounts to intercept financial data or manipulate transactions. Exploited vectors include authentication bypass, insecure storage, or network sniffing.

components.name: Payment Gateways
components.description: Systems processing financial transactions for consumer electronics purchases.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-311: Missing Encryption of Sensitive Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing encryption of sensitive data allows theft of payment card information during transactions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-312: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Cleartext storage of sensitive information exposes payment details to unauthorized access.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-319: Cleartext Transmission of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Cleartext transmission of sensitive information enables interception of payment data.

components.name: Customer Accounts
components.description: User profiles containing payment methods and shipping information.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-312: Cleartext Storage of Sensitive Information
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Cleartext storage of sensitive information allows theft of payment credentials.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-522: Insufficiently Protected Credentials
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficiently protected credentials can lead to payment method compromise.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-359: Exposure of Private Personal Information to an Unauthorized Actor
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Exposure of private information to unauthorized actor enables identity theft.

components.name: Transaction Processing
components.description: Systems validating and executing payment operations.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing authentication for critical function allows fraudulent transaction processing.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-639: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Authorization bypass through user-controlled key enables unauthorized transactions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-352: Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Cross-site request forgery allows attackers to initiate unauthorized transactions.

threat: Bypass of Licensing or Access Controls for Unlocking Premium Features
threat_description: Attackers may circumvent license verification, feature flag controls, or software restrictions to unlock premium functionality without authorization. This threat is enabled by improper client-side enforcement or insufficient backend validation.

components.name: License Management
components.description: Systems controlling access to premium features based on purchase status.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-602: Client-Side Enforcement of Server-Side Security
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Client-side enforcement of server-side security allows bypassing of license checks.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-565: Reliance on Cookies without Validation and Integrity Checking
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Reliance on cookies without validation enables tampering with license status.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-290: Authentication Bypass by Spoofing
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Authentication bypass by spoofing allows impersonation of licensed users.

components.name: Feature Flags
components.description: Configuration settings that enable or disable specific product capabilities.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-642: External Control of Critical State Data
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: External control of critical state data allows manipulation of feature availability.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-15: External Control of System or Configuration Setting
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: External control of system or configuration settings enables unauthorized feature activation.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-732: Incorrect Permission Assignment for Critical Resource
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Incorrect permission assignment for critical resource allows modification of feature flags.

components.name: Hardware Capabilities
components.description: Physical components with software-controlled access restrictions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-284: Improper Access Control
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper access control allows unauthorized enabling of hardware capabilities.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-272: Least Privilege Violation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Least privilege violation enables access to restricted hardware functions.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-1220: Insufficient Granularity of Access Controls
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficient granularity of access controls allows bypassing hardware restrictions.

threat: Manipulation of Warranty and Return Systems
threat_description: Manipulation of warranty systems to obtain unauthorized replacements, repairs, or refunds for consumer electronics products. Attackers may falsify purchase records, damage reports, or exploit gaps in verification processes.

components.name: Warranty Management Systems
components.description: Platforms tracking product warranties and processing claims.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-345: Insufficient Verification of Data Authenticity
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Insufficient verification of data authenticity allows submission of fraudulent warranty claims.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-807: Reliance on Untrusted Inputs in a Security Decision
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Reliance on untrusted inputs in a security decision enables warranty fraud.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-20: Improper Input Validation
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper input validation allows manipulation of warranty claim data.

components.name: Return Processing
components.description: Systems managing product returns and replacements.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-306: Missing Authentication for Critical Function
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Missing authentication for critical function allows unauthorized product returns or exchanges.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-639: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Authorization bypass through user-controlled key enables fraudulent return approvals.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-285: Improper Authorization
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper authorization allows processing of fraudulent return requests.

components.name: Repair Services
components.description: Systems managing technical support and repair operations.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-639: Authorization Bypass Through User-Controlled Key
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Authorization bypass through user-controlled key allows fraudulent access to repair services.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-287: Improper Authentication
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Improper authentication enables unauthorized access to premium support services.

cwes.cwe_id: CWE-290: Authentication Bypass by Spoofing
cwes.cwe_mapping_reason: Authentication bypass by spoofing allows impersonation of eligible customers.
